column1:
share on x ms mary schultz. jun 11 at 11:11 am jan was always part of our youth group. i have fond memories of her coming to act iii in her scrubs after pulling a night shift at ormc and playing guitar for our opening songs. "i am the resurrection, i am the life, he who believes in me, even if he die, he shall live forever and i will raise you up, and i will raise you up, and i will raise you up on the last day."comment share comment share facebook twitter share on x more memories... currently no events are scheduled. wall 365 days of grief support. subscribe facebook twitter haisley funeral and cremation service website designed by funeralone contact obituaries about store 
show less view & service share facebook twitter google+ post now light a candle virtual gifts yellow rose periwinkle blue green red dove angel heart hug butterfly roses hands in prayer bible sunshine teddy american flag veteran rosary gardener interlocked rings catholic cross football baseball golf sailboat firefighter non catholic cross basketball police buddha hockey coach soccer star of david canadian flag menorah memories events media share a memory of jan "angel" engel send comfort to the engel family when it's needed most. to show you care same-day hand delivery by a local florist! ht holly tetzloff. jun 11 at 12:17 pm we remember jan as an amazingly intelligent woman, with a loving heart and a strong faith in god, who dearly loved her family. we remember her laugh, which was contagious. we remember her gift of music and the times she sang or played the flute, especially duets with pastor. we also enjoyed our visits with jan last fall and this spring; she was positive and upbeat, and enjoyed having her beloved cat closeby. we will always remember jan as pastor's angel, and we will miss her dearly. comment share comment share facebook twitter
